Package com.gpch.mongo.service

Class UserJobService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gpch.mongo.service.UserJobService

  • @Service
public class UserJobService
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Gage Hoefer This class functions as the primary point of contact for all service methods involving UserJob objects- it relies on the built in services offered by the UserJobRepository class. These services include saving UserJob objects in the database, deleting UserJob objects both in general and by a specific id, and manipulating UserJob objects in various ways.

        public UserJob saveUserJob​(UserJob userJob)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        UserJob This method is given a UserJob object, and uses an instance of the UserJobRepository class to save said object in the database.

      • getAllUserJobs

        public java.lang.Iterable<UserJob> getAllUserJobs​()
        Returns:
        Iterable This method uses an instance of the UserJobRepository class to retrieve all UserJob objects stored in the database, returning them in the form of an iterable list of UserJob objects.

        public void deleteAllUserJobs​()

      • deleteUserJobById

        public void deleteUserJobById​(java.lang.String id)
        Parameters:
        id - This method is given a String representing the id for a specific UserJob object stored in the database, and uses an instance of the UserJobRepository class to delete the UserJob based on said id.

      • findUserJobById

        public java.util.Optional<UserJob> findUserJobById​(java.lang.String id)
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        Optional This method is given a String representing the id for a specific UserJob object stored in the database, and uses an instance of the UserJobRepository class to retrieve the UserJob, returning it in the form of an Optional object of type UserJob.

      • setUserJobUserId

        public void setUserJobUserId​(java.lang.String id,
                             java.lang.String user_id)
        Parameters:
        id -
        user_id - This method is given a String representing the id for a specific UserJob object, and a String representing a user id; with these, the method uses an instance of the UserJobRepository class to set the user id for the UserJob.

      • setUserJobJobId

        Parameters:
        id -
        job_id - This method is given a String representing the id for a specific UserJob object, and a String representing a job id; with these, the method uses an instance of the UserJobRepository class to set the job id for the UserJob.
